body:
The makefile version of zstd is great in the sense that it should be rather easy to build, but it doesn't give you a whole lot of flexibility. In particular it could be useful to only build static libs so that squashfuse/mksquash can easily create binaries without dependencies for simple deployment.

Also adds missing optional dependencies for the executables.

Note that cmake does not have all these warning flags that were patched for the nvhpc compiler
title: Switch to cmake in zstd to configure more easily
